bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler, April 17, 1950

div1.p: Hench encourages Siler to stay in contact with Wallach. He feels that Wallach's activities should be guided by the Walter Reed Memorial Association.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler, April 17, 1950
div1.opener:
April 17, 1950
Colonel J. F. Siler
1835 Eye Street, N. W.
Washington, D. C.
My dear Colonel Siler:
div1.p:
I do hope that you will keep in
touch with Mr. Wallach because I am in agreement with
General Kean and General Truby that his activities
should be guided very definitely by the Walter
Reed Memorial Association. I do not think that
he should be allowed to go on without such
guidance and since he is down east it might be pos-
sible for him to come to Washington and have an
informal meeting with two or three local members
of the Association. They could learn from him
what he plans to do and they could undoubtedly
help him with better planning.

When will the plaque to Walter Reed
on the hospital be put up? Perhaps it is already
up. If not would it be appropriate to have a
little ceremony on the occasion?
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
